Perhaps what you're listening to is too: Perhaps what you're listening to is too niche
Use varying shapes for password characte: Use varying shapes for password characters

Press Super+G to open the overlay and pi: Press Super+G to open the overlay and pin the crosshair
Change any time later with /dark, /light:
Change any time later with /dark, /light, /wallpaper in the launcher
If the shell's colours aren't changing:
    1. Open the right sidebar with Super+N
    2. Click "Reload Hyprland & Quickshell" in the top-right corner
DPI (Dots Per Inch) controls mouse sensi:
DPI (Dots Per Inch) controls mouse sensitivity.
Higher DPI = faster cursor movement.
You can have multiple presets and cycle through them using the DPI button on your mouse.
Tip: Close a window with Super+Q: Tip: Close a window with Super+Q
Conflicts with the shell's system tray i: Conflicts with the shell's system tray implementation
Audio input | Right-click for volume mix: Audio input | Right-click for volume mixer & device selector
Arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select\:
Arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select
Esc or click anywhere to cancel
Use the system file picker instead\nRigh:
Use the system file picker instead
Right-click to make this the default behavior
Conflicts with the shell's notification: Conflicts with the shell's notification implementation
Audio output | Right-click for volume mi: Audio output | Right-click for volume mixer & device selector
Enjoy! You can reopen the welcome app an: Enjoy! You can reopen the welcome app any time with <tt>Super+Shift+Alt+/</tt>. To open the settings app, hit <tt>Super+I</tt>
Reset all settings (DPI, polling rate, b: Reset all settings (DPI, polling rate, button bindings) to default values
Tip: right-clicking a group\nalso expand:
Tip: right-clicking a group
also expands it
Adjust DPI value for selected preset: Adjust DPI value for selected preset
There might be a download in progress: There might be a download in progress
Night Light | Right-click to toggle Auto: Night Light | Right-click to toggle Auto mode
Pick wallpaper image on your system: Pick wallpaper image on your system
For storing API keys and other sensitive: For storing API keys and other sensitive information
Usage: <tt>%1superpaste NUM_OF_ENTRIES[i:
Usage: <tt>%1superpaste NUM_OF_ENTRIES[i]</tt>
Supply <tt>i</tt> when you want images
Examples:
<tt>%1superpaste 4i</tt> for the last 4 images
<tt>%1superpaste 7</tt> for the last 7 entries
Customize what each mouse button does.\n:
Customise what each mouse button does.

Click the record button to capture a key press,
or use the dropdown to select from common actions.

Set to 'Disabled' to deactivate a button.
Force hover open at absolute corner: Force hover open at absolute corner
Polling rate determines how often the mo:
Polling rate determines how often the mouse reports its position.
Higher rates = smoother movement but more CPU usage.

â€¢ 125Hz: 8ms response (basic)
â€¢ 250Hz: 4ms response (good)
â€¢ 500Hz: 2ms response (better)
â€¢ 1000Hz: 1ms response (best for gaming)
Example use case: eroge on one workspace: Example use case: eroge on one workspace, dark Discord window on another
Click to cycle through power profiles: Click to cycle through power profiles
Make sure you have songrec installed: Make sure you have songrec installed
Make sure your player has MPRIS support\:
Make sure your player has MPRIS support
or try turning off duplicate player filtering
Connection failed. Please inspect manual: Connection failed. Please inspect manually with the <tt>warp-cli</tt> command
Type your notes here.\nStart a line with:
Type your notes here.
Start a line with '-' to make it copyable.
Click to record a key press: Click to record a key press
Font family name (e.g., Google Sans Flex: Font family name (e.g., Google Sans Flex)

Click to toggle light/dark mode

LMB to enable/disable

Scroll to swap position
Recognize music | Right-click to toggle: Recognise music | Right-click to toggle source
Shows mouse name and battery status: Shows mouse name and battery status
Reset all mouse settings to default valu: Reset all mouse settings to default values
Failed to detect mouse. Check if rivalcf: Failed to detect mouse. Check if rivalcfg is installed in the Python environment.
Show a client-side titlebar in shell app: Show a client-side titlebar in shell applications like this settings window
Maximum volume increase allowed in a sin: Maximum volume increase allowed in a single step
Automatically suspend the system when ba: Automatically suspend the system when battery drops to the threshold
Require a click instead of hover to show: Require a click instead of hover to show tooltips on bar elements
Apply material colors to terminal emulat:
Apply material colors to terminal emulators via OSC escape sequences.
Affects all running terminal sessions in real time.
Limits volume jumps and sets a maximum a:
Limits volume jumps and sets a maximum allowed volume level.
Protects your ears from sudden loud audio.
Settings for the sidebar translation ser: Settings for the sidebar translation service
Controls how material colors are generat:
Controls how material colors are generated from your wallpaper.
"Auto" detects the best scheme based on image saturation.
Mixes a slight tint of the primary color: Mixes a slight tint of the primary color into background layers for a more cohesive look
URL prefix for reverse image searches.\n:
URL prefix for reverse image searches.
e.g. https://lens.google.com/uploadbyurl?url=
Delay before the bar appears after press: Delay before the bar appears after pressing Super
Used for displaying numeric values like: Used for displaying numeric values like clocks, counters, and resource monitors
Unlocks your GNOME Keyring when unlockin:
Unlocks your GNOME Keyring when unlocking the screen.
Needed for browsers and apps that store passwords.
Recommended if using lock on startup instead of a display manager.
Remove duplicate MPRIS players that appe:
Remove duplicate MPRIS players that appear when using Plasma Browser Integration.
Prevents seeing the same media controls twice.
Controls the language used throughout th:
Controls the language used throughout the shell UI.
"Auto" will follow your system locale setting.
Show mouse DPI/sensitivity controls in t: Show mouse DPI/sensitivity controls in the sidebar
Briefly dim the screen when waking from:
Briefly dim the screen when waking from sleep to protect eyes from sudden brightness.
Especially helpful in dark environments.
Toggle which sliders appear in the sideb: Toggle which sliders appear in the sidebar control panel
Used for large blocks of text like notif: Used for large blocks of text like notification bodies
Increases scroll sensitivity for touchpa: Increases scroll sensitivity for touchpad users in shell elements
Commands used by the shell to launch var:
Commands used by the shell to launch various applications.
Change these if you use different apps than the defaults.
Detect content regions using a local ima:
Detect content regions using a local image processing algorithm.
May not always be accurate.
Draw a background behind the bar. Disabl: Draw a background behind the bar. Disabling makes the bar transparent.
Apply material colors to Qt/KDE applicat:
Apply material colors to Qt/KDE applications via kdeglobals.
Requires shell & GTK theming to be enabled.
Updates titlebars, menubars, and widget colors in apps like Dolphin, KCalc, etc.
Apply a monochrome tint to dock applicat: Apply a monochrome tint to dock application icons to match the current theme
Width of the invisible edge region that: Width of the invisible edge region that triggers the bar to show
Prevents sudden volume spikes and limits:
Prevents sudden volume spikes and limits maximum volume.
Protects hearing when switching between quiet and loud content.
Automatically enable night light based o: Automatically enable night light based on the time schedule below
Hour when night light deactivates (24h f: Hour when night light deactivates (24h format)
Hour when night light activates (24h for: Hour when night light activates (24h format)
Display temperature in Fahrenheit instea: Display temperature in Fahrenheit instead of Celsius
Set a custom accent color hex (e.g. #FF5: Set a custom accent color hex (e.g. #FF5733). Leave empty to derive from wallpaper.
Use your device's location to fetch weat:
Use your device's location to fetch weather.
Disable to manually specify a city below.
Duration of the long break session: Duration of the long break session
Enable the workspace overview grid, acce: Enable the workspace overview grid, accessible via the overview key
Threshold for how aggressively colors ar: Threshold for how aggressively colors are harmonized. Lower = more vibrant individual colors.
Use system file picker for wallpaper: Use system file picker for wallpaper
Replace F1â€“F12 labels with symbolic ic: Replace F1â€“F12 labels with symbolic icons
Choose a symbol to represent the Super/M: Choose a symbol to represent the Super/Meta key in keybind displays
Characters that trigger specific search: Characters that trigger specific search modes when typed at the start of a query
Language to translate INTO. \"auto\" use:
Language to translate INTO. "auto" uses your system locale.
Run `trans -list-all` for available language codes.
Style and layout of the quick toggle but: Style and layout of the quick toggle buttons in the sidebar
Notify when battery reaches this level w:
Notify when battery reaches this level while charging.
Set to 101 to disable.
How long the OSD (volume/brightness indi: How long the OSD (volume/brightness indicator) stays visible
Dims background content when overlays ar:
Dims background content when overlays are open.
Improves focus and readability of overlay content.
Delay before showing non-app results (we: Delay before showing non-app results (web, math, etc.) to prevent lag while typing
Show the corner trigger region on screen: Show the corner trigger region on screen for positioning reference
Show more detailed information in bar mo: Show more detailed information in bar modules. Increases bar width.
Configure the pomodoro productivity time: Configure the pomodoro productivity timer durations (in seconds)
Hide tray items that report a passive/in: Hide tray items that report a passive/inactive status
Keep terminal backgrounds dark regardles:
Keep terminal backgrounds dark regardless of the system light/dark mode.
Reduces eye strain for terminal-heavy workflows.
URL prefix for web searches. The query w:
URL prefix for web searches. The query will be appended.
e.g. https://duckduckgo.com/?q=
Transparency level for content container: Transparency level for content container layers
Used for decorative and expressive text: Used for decorative and expressive text elements
Duration of each short break session: Duration of each short break session
Maximum DPI value for the mouse sensitiv: Maximum DPI value for the mouse sensitivity slider in the sidebar
When enabled, all tray items are pinned:
When enabled, all tray items are pinned by default.
The pinned items list becomes an exclusion list.
Show âŒƒ for Ctrl, âŒ¥ for Alt, â‡§ for: Show âŒƒ for Ctrl, âŒ¥ for Alt, â‡§ for Shift, etc.
Require a click to reveal tooltips inste:
Require a click to reveal tooltips instead of hover.
Useful for touchscreen or accessibility needs.
Hyprland may leave 1 pixel on the right:
Hyprland may leave 1 pixel on the right edge unresponsive to interactions.
Enable this to work around that issue.
Disable transparency for better readabil:
Disable transparency for better readability and reduced visual complexity.
Useful for users who find translucent elements distracting.
Absolute maximum volume (up to 153% for: Absolute maximum volume (up to 153% for amplified output)
Display workspace numbers using the conf: Display workspace numbers using the configured Nerd Font
How often CPU, RAM, and swap usage are r: How often CPU, RAM, and swap usage are refreshed
Always display CPU usage in the bar, eve: Always display CPU usage in the bar, even when idle
Use macOS-like symbols for modifier keys: Use macOS-like symbols for modifier keys
Display the number of unread notificatio: Display the number of unread notifications on the bar indicator
Uses Levenshtein distance instead of fuz:
Uses Levenshtein distance instead of fuzzy sort.
Better for typo tolerance but may give unexpected results.
Acronyms like "GIMP" might not match.
Show a gentle update reminder when this: Show a gentle update reminder when this many packages are available
Used for general UI text throughout the: Used for general UI text throughout the shell
Automatically adjusts transparency based:
Automatically adjusts transparency based on wallpaper vibrancy.
Disable to set manual values below.
Highlight RAM usage when it exceeds this: Highlight RAM usage when it exceeds this percentage
Generate and apply material colors to th:
Generate and apply material colors to the shell, GTK apps, and other themed elements.
Disabling this skips all color generation when switching wallpapers.
Number of focus-break cycles before a lo: Number of focus-break cycles before a long break
When hover-to-trigger is off, still allo:
When hover-to-trigger is off, still allow hovering the very corner to open.
The rest of the region is used for volume/brightness scroll.
Play a zoom animation when opening overl: Play a zoom animation when opening overlays like the launcher or overview
Leave empty to only copy screenshots to: Leave empty to only copy screenshots to clipboard without saving to disk
Freedesktop sound theme used for notific: Freedesktop sound theme used for notification and event sounds
Show the translator panel in the right s: Show the translator panel in the right sidebar
Adds a password prompt before power off:
Adds a password prompt before power off or restart from the lock screen.
Note: physical power buttons can always force shutdown.
Split modifier + key into separate keyca: Split modifier + key into separate keycaps
Scroll delta at or above this value is t:
Scroll delta at or above this value is treated as mouse scroll (vs touchpad).
Helps distinguish between mouse wheel and touchpad gestures.
Show action results even when you haven':
Show action results even when you haven't typed the action prefix.
Disable if you only want actions when explicitly prefixed.
Show an urgent update warning when this: Show an urgent update warning when this many packages are pending
Height of the invisible hover region at: Height of the invisible hover region at the screen edge that triggers the dock
Scroll in the corner region to adjust br: Scroll in the corner region to adjust brightness or volume
Display Material Design shape icons inst: Display Material Design shape icons instead of dots for password entry
How much terminal colors blend with the: How much terminal colors blend with the wallpaper palette. Higher = more unified look.
Show dock when hovering over the bottom:
Show dock when hovering over the bottom edge.
When disabled, dock only shows on empty workspaces.
Always show the dock when the session st: Always show the dock when the session starts
Enables translucent backgrounds for shel: Enables translucent backgrounds for shell elements
Automatically kill other system tray imp: Automatically kill other system tray implementations that may conflict
Show seconds in all clocks. Increases up: Show seconds in all clocks. Increases update frequency.
An arbitrary delay to work around timing:
An arbitrary delay to work around timing issues in Hyprland IPC.
Increase this if you experience glitches on startup.
Hides the wallpaper layer when a window: Hides the wallpaper layer when a window is in fullscreen mode to save resources
Draws rounded corners over the screen ed: Draws rounded corners over the screen edges. Useful for displays without physical rounded corners.
Always use dark background in terminal r: Always use dark background in terminal regardless of light/dark mode
Absolute maximum volume level (up to 153: Absolute maximum volume level (up to 153% for amplified output)
Use the native system file dialog instea:
Use the native system file dialog instead of the built-in wallpaper browser.
May be needed if the built-in browser has issues on your system.
Number of historical data points kept fo: Number of historical data points kept for resource usage graphs
Opacity level when an overlay is in clic: Opacity level when an overlay is in click-through mode
Zooms the wallpaper slightly to hide blu: Zooms the wallpaper slightly to hide blur edge artifacts
Translation backend to use. \"auto\" pic:
Translation backend to use. "auto" picks the best available.
Run `trans -list-engines` in terminal for options.

Used for headings and section titles: Used for headings and section titles
How long notifications remain on screen: How long notifications remain on screen if the app doesn't specify a duration
Battery percentage at which a low batter: Battery percentage at which a low battery warning is shown
Size of workspace previews relative to s: Size of workspace previews relative to screen size
Highlight interactive regions when using: Highlight interactive regions when using the screen snipping tool
Show the lock screen when the session st:
Show the lock screen when the session starts.
Useful if not using a display manager that handles login.
HTTP User-Agent header used by shell ser: HTTP User-Agent header used by shell services (weather, web search, etc.)
Show \"Ctrl\" + \"A\" as separate keys i: Show "Ctrl" + "A" as separate keys instead of combined "Ctrl A"
How time is displayed in the bar and oth: How time is displayed in the bar and other shell elements
Display labels on detected target region: Display labels on detected target regions
Automatically kill other notification da: Automatically kill other notification daemons (e.g. dunst, mako) that may conflict with the shell
Show a dock at the bottom of the screen: Show a dock at the bottom of the screen with pinned and running applications
Open sidebars by clicking or hovering at: Open sidebars by clicking or hovering at screen corners, independent of bar position
Open screenshots in Satty for annotation:
Open screenshots in Satty for annotation instead of copying directly.
Requires Satty to be installed.
Maximum time to attempt music recognitio: Maximum time to attempt music recognition before giving up
Keeps the right sidebar content in memor:
Keeps the right sidebar content in memory to reduce opening delay.
Uses ~15MB extra RAM. Recommended for slower systems or if you open it frequently.
Language to translate FROM. \"auto\" det: Language to translate FROM. "auto" detects automatically.
How often to check for available system: How often to check for available system updates
Fine-tune how terminal colors are genera: Fine-tune how terminal colors are generated from the wallpaper palette
Prevents triggering when approaching alo:
Prevents triggering when approaching along the horizontal edge.
Higher values require approaching more from the vertical edge.
Height of the dock in pixels: Height of the dock in pixels
Replace text like \"Scroll â†“\" and \"L: Replace text like "Scroll â†“" and "LMB" with symbolic mouse icons
Delay before sending translation request:
Delay before sending translation requests after typing stops.
Higher values reduce rate limiting and network load.
Display a drop shadow behind the bar whe: Display a drop shadow behind the bar when using Float corner style
Qt date format strings. See Qt documenta:
Qt date format strings. See Qt documentation for format codes.

Used for code, terminal output, and fixe: Used for code, terminal output, and fixed-width text
Screenshot save path (leave empty to jus: Screenshot save path (leave empty to just copy)
Terminal emulator command used for shell: Terminal emulator command used for shell actions
Increases contrast of text in terminals. Higher = brighter foreground text.

Display the internal identifier of each:
Display the internal identifier of each system tray item.
Useful for configuring the pinned items list.
Disables animations across the shell, Hy:
Disables animations across the shell, Hyprland compositor, and overlays.
Recommended for users sensitive to motion effects or for performance.
